TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit KeyToVectorExtensions extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Extension methods for the static-pipeline over objects.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<float> ToBaggedVector<TKey> (this Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.VarVector<Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Key<TKey>> input);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector`1<float32> ToBaggedVector<TKey>(class Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.VarVector`1<class Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Key`1<!!TKey>> input) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function ToBaggedVector(Of TKey) (input As VarVector(Of Key(Of TKey))) As Vector(Of Single)
static member ToBaggedVector : Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.VarVector<Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Key<'Key>> -> Microsoft.ML.StaticPipe.Vector<single>

Docs.summary: Takes a column of key type of known cardinality and produces an indicator vector of floats. Each key value of the input is used to create an indicator vector: the indicator vector is the length of the key cardinality, where all values are 0, except for the entry corresponding to the value of the key, which is 1. If the key value is missing, then all values are 0. Naturally this tends to generate very sparse vectors. In this case then the indicator vectors for all values in the column will be simply added together, to produce the final vector with type equal to the key cardinality; so, in all cases, whether vector or scalar, the output column will be a vector type of length equal to that cardinality.
